cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and meander inland over eastern Texas and western Louisiana through the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port Mansfield and San Luis Pass (near Port O'Connor/Corpus Christi area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Texas coast from Boca De Catan (Mexico) to High Island, TX including Port Mansfield–San Luis Pass (hurricane, tropical-storm, and storm-surge watches)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana (with effects extending into southeast Louisiana)
weather_observation.wind: Low (11%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy with occasional gusts below gale strength.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge (<3 ft) possible mainly west of the Mississippi River delta; significant surge not expected at New Orleans.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 3–6 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, bringing risk of urban and low-lying area flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and dangerous rip currents on Gulf beaches; elevated seas in approaches to the Lower Mississippi River channel.
